poem:
**Frankie Monroe: Dragged to the Depths**

Rotherham's painted jester,  
grin wide as a harlequin's dream—  
dance of the damned,  
echoes in checkered gloom.  
Below, where shadows  
whisper louder than cries,  
the stage flares—  
scarlet laughter,  
unrehearsed.  
Life's finale  
in garish jest,  
haunted marquee—  
exit now, through  
curtains of flame.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Joe Kent-Walters is Frankie Monroe: Dead!!! (Good Fun Time) review – garish grins With his painted face and demonic demeanour, Joe Kent-Walters’ alter ego Frankie Monroe has been compared to the League of Gentlemen’s Papa Lazarou. It’s Lazarus he more resembles in this follow-up to last year’s debut, which won Kent-Walters a best newcomer award. In Live!!!, the monstrous MC of a Rotherham working men’s club was dragged to hell after the expiry of his". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
